title: What is causing my PC to crash? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, I am not an expert at this but what I can tell you is that you may have many problems. The main problem which happens to users is when an important file in the folder “system32” corrupts; more specifically the boot files which MUST NOT be touched. You can either: Insert a USB stick and reinstall Windows.Contact Microsoft on: Microsoft - Official Home PageGo on the special app: Get Help.Another special app: Quick Assist.Call microsoft by phone on: 1 800-642-7676.if you need any further help, comment on this answer. Thanks, Alexander Busuttil Cazac. A 12 year old boy.

Multiple reasons PSU would be my first check if that continues to have issues after a PSU unit I would check RAM, CPU or Video card if that all passes in a different motherboard I would change the motherboard out, the most that goes out on motherboards are your VRM's I just had a MSI with a 9590 that has the VRM's have failed
